original: Lilja, Einar Albert, läroverksadjunkt, Göteborg, f. 16/6/00 i Malmö av A. Lilja o. Anna Holmström. G. 35 m. Siri Olsson. Barn: Inger f. 37, Eva 43. — Stud:ex. 22, fil. kand. i Lund 25, teol. kand. 28, teol. lic. 45, disp. f. teol. doktorsgrad 47, prov-år v. Gbgs folksk :sem. 32, prästv. 42. Vik. folkskollär. 24, vik. ämneslär. v. Malmö komm. mellansk. fyra mån. 25-27, vik. adj. v. Malmö realsk. 28, e. o. ämneslär. i Tidaholm 28-30, vik. lektor v. Skara folksk :sem. 30-32, Gbgs folksk :sem. kortare tid 32, Karlstads h. a. 1. 33, extralär. v. Malmö gosslärov. 33-35, adj. i kristend :kunsk. o. hist. m. samh :lära i Varberg 35, dito v. Hvitfeldtska h. a. 1. i Gbg sed. 40, timlär. v. Gbgs ^samsk. sed. 41. Var i Varberg även vik. rektor vissa tider 39-40 samt rektors skrivbitr. Föreläs, i Västra Sv :es folkbildn :förb. o. Hall. folkbildn iförb. Resor t. Danm. 24 o. 26, Tyskl. 29 o. 30, m. stip. f. stud. av kristend :undervisn. 38. Skr.: Den sv. katekestrad. mell. Svebilius o. Lindblom (grad:avh. 47), art. i fack- o. dagspress samt rec.
translated: Lilja, Einar Albert, high school teacher, Gothenburg, b. June 16, 1900 in Malmö to A. Lilja and Anna Holmström. Married in 1935 to Siri Olsson. Children: Inger b. 1937, Eva b. 1943. - Education: graduated from high school in 1922, Bachelor of Arts in Lund in 1925, Bachelor of Theology in 1928, Licentiate of Theology in 1945, dissertation for doctoral degree in theology in 1947. Provisional year at Gothenburg elementary school seminary in 1932, ordained as a priest in 1942. Substitute primary school teacher in 1924, substitute subject teacher at Malmö city middle school for four months in 1925-1927, substitute teacher at Malmö realskola in 1928, temporary subject teacher in Tidaholm in 1928-1930, substitute lecturer at Skara elementary school seminary in 1930-1932, Gothenburg elementary school seminary for a shorter period in 1932, Karlstad upper secondary school in 1933, extracurricular teacher at Malmö boys' school in 1933-1935, teacher in Christian education, history, and social studies in Varberg in 1935, the same position at Hvitfeldtska upper secondary school in Gothenburg since 1940, hourly teacher at Gothenburg civic school since 1941. Also served as a substitute principal in Varberg during certain periods in 1939-1940 and as a principal's secretary. Lecturer for the Western Swedish adult education association and Halland adult education association. Traveled to Denmark in 1924 and 1926, Germany in 1929 and 1930, with scholarships for the study of Christian education in 1938. Written works: "Den svenska katekestraditionen mellan Svebilius och Lindblom" (dissertation, 1947), articles in professional and daily press, and reviews.

employmentHistory.jobTitle: Teacher in Christian Education, History, and Social Studies
